contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Boffius'' | fossil_range = [[Paleocene]] | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | ordo = [[Multituberculata]] | familia = '''Boffiidae''' | genus = '''''Boffius''''' | species = '''''B. splendidus''''' | binomial = ''Boffius splendidus'' | binomial_authority = [[Vianey-Liaud M.]], 1979 }} '''''Boffius''''' is a [[genus]] of [[mammal]] from the [[Paleocene]] of [[Europe]]. It is a member of the [[extinct]] order of [[Multituberculata]]. It lies within the suborder [[Cimolodonta]] and is the only known member of the family '''Boffiidae''' (Hahn & Hahn, 1983). The genus was named by Vianey-Liaud M. in 1979. The species ''Boffius splendidus'' is known from Lower Paleocene remains found in Hainin, [[Belgium]]. It was a relatively large multituberculate. == References == * Vianey-Liaud (1979), "Les Mammifères montiens de Hainin (Paléocene moyen de Belgique). Part I, Multituberculés". ''Palaeovertebrata'' '''9''', p.117-131. * Kielan-Jaworowska Z & Hurum JH (2001), "Phylogeny and Systematics of multituberculate mammals". ''Paleontology'' '''44''', p.389-429. * Much of this information has been derived from [http://home.arcor.de/ktdykes/cimolod.htm] MESOZOIC MAMMALS; 'basal' [[Cimolodonta]], [[Cimolomyidae]], Boffiidae and [[Kogaionidae]], an Internet directory. [[Category:Cimolodonts]] [[Category:Paleocene mammals]] [[Category:Paleocene extinctions]]
